intro: Cryptostylis gracilis, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is an evergreen hemiparasitic plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant attaches itself to the branches of host trees, such as eucalypts, through its haustoria, which extract water and nutrients. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that disperses seeds through animal consumption. Cryptostylis gracilis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, supporting various insect species and contributing to forest biodiversity.
